subject: What is Quality?
description: Quality refers to the degree of excellence of a product or service. It encompasses various attributes that meet customer expectations.

subject: Functional and Non-Functional Quality Attributes
description: Functional attributes define what a system does, while non-functional attributes describe how it performs under certain conditions.

subject: Test Levels
description: Test levels represent different stages of testing, including unit testing, integration testing, and system testing.

subject: Importance of Quality Assurance
description: Quality assurance ensures that a product meets specified requirements. It reduces risks and enhances customer satisfaction.

subject: Quality Control vs. Quality Assurance
description: Quality control focuses on identifying defects, while quality assurance emphasizes preventing defects in processes.

subject: Defining Quality Metrics
description: Quality metrics are standards used to measure the quality of a product. They help in evaluating performance and improvement areas.

subject: Continuous Improvement
description: Continuous improvement is an ongoing effort to enhance products, services, or processes. It involves regular feedback and adaptation.

subject: User Acceptance Testing
description: User acceptance testing ensures that a product meets user needs and requirements before it goes live. It's the final validation step.

subject: The Role of Test Automation
description: Test automation improves efficiency and accuracy in testing. It allows for faster feedback and more frequent testing cycles.

subject: Risk-Based Testing
description: Risk-based testing prioritizes testing efforts based on the potential impact of identified risks. It ensures critical areas are tested first.

subject: Performance Testing
description: Performance testing evaluates how a system performs under load. It identifies bottlenecks and ensures reliability under stress.

subject: Regression Testing
description: Regression testing ensures that new code changes do not adversely affect existing functionality. It verifies stability over time.

subject: The Importance of Documentation
description: Documentation in testing provides a reference for future projects. It ensures consistency and facilitates knowledge transfer.

subject: Exploratory Testing
description: Exploratory testing allows testers to explore the application without predefined tests. It uncovers issues that scripted tests might miss.

subject: The Significance of Test Plans
description: Test plans outline the testing strategy, objectives, and scope. They ensure all aspects of testing are considered and organized.

subject: Collaboration in Testing
description: Collaboration among team members enhances the testing process. It fosters communication and ensures all perspectives are considered.
